data.title: Stunning building full of history
data.text: The capitol was restored in the past 10 years or so and it is very beautiful inside and out. The hour-long tour is interesting. A must-see for locals and tourists alike.

user_location.name: Clifton Park, New York, United States

data.title: Woodworking
data.text: Building is chock full of antiques and history. So much to see. I had occasion to visit it many times because of my work. Be sure to go with a guide or you may miss about 60% of., what you should see. Franklin Roosevelt, Teddy Roosevelt etc

data.title: They don't build them like this anymore.
data.text: Impressive building and architecture. There is a display of local NY artwork in one of the halls (2nd floor). NY Historical treasure. Answer this trivia question if you visit (don't use the internet.) "Which four US presidents were NY governors."  There are free tours M-F that are informative. We enjoyed our visit very much.

data.title: Architecture and history
data.text:
You'll love the feel of the stone walls and the fabulous staircases as well as being able to over look government at work or not lol
From the expansive verandas overlooking the south mall to just checking out the exterior it's worth the trip and of course it should be coupled with a stop at the Albany museum

data.title: Wow what a building
data.text:
Amazing architecture. worth a road trip just for photo opt.
Also dept of education building across the street is stunning

data.title: Take the tour
data.text: We did the one hour tour,miss an impressive building on the outside and incredible on the inside, the Senate Chamber was magnificent, all good and elaborate. The carvings on the staircase were intricate. There are do many different architectural styles and influences.

data.title: Nation's Best
data.text: The proud Icon of New York's capital, beautiful architectural design, it's standing tall and strong with its beautiful surrounding garden.

data.title: Capitol Tour
data.text:
Each year in Albany, the New York Association for Continuing/Community Education (NYACCE) hold our annual "Outstanding Student of the Year" event for adult students. This year, we decided to schedule tours for our students and their guests of the Capitol. The group who took the first tour were so impressed with the tour and we in awe of the Capitol. They traveled from all corners of NYS but none of them had ever seen the Capitol.

My group was lead by tour guide, George McCroy. He is awesome! Because our second group was very small, he took us into areas that most normally would not go on the tour. Extremely knowledgeable of the Capitol's history and answered any questions we had. 

If you find yourself in Albany, take the Capitol tour! Well worth the time and ask for George McCroy. Best guide ever!

data.title: Amazingly beautiful building!
data.text: The detail and materials used in this crazily done State Capitol building are almost beyond amazing! It took 32 years to build and five different architects! My group had a wonderful tour, however, and I really recommend a visit here and a tour.

data.title: Beautiful architecture and artwork
data.text: Spent 2 hrs.Start from top and walk down steps.Beautiful building and paintings.Met Lt. Gov. Hochul.

data.title: A lovely historic city
data.text: We were very impressed by the history, layout and architecture of Albany. New York State University was most impressive, so too were the government buildings. Well worth a visit.

data.title: Beautiful from outside...
data.text: A magnificent building from the outside. However when I attempted to visit the inside I was unable to take in my pocket knife and my only option was to throw it away. I opted to keep my knife and leave

data.title: old architecture keep us in awe
data.text: My grandchild had a field trip here and I must say we loved it. She is a fifth grader who is really into history and as she put it, it was "The awesomest field trip ever". You can tell they have taken the time to keep the building's integrity. I think the best part was hearing the stories and history of this grand building. Its a lot of walking and several stairs so make sure you have comfortable shoes.

data.title: Beautiful Architecture
data.text: The quality of the craftsmanship is amazing as is the detail.  It's a building that wouldn't be reproduced today.  The tour is free and our guide was very knowledgeable. He was able to answer every question people asked.  The tour lasted just over an hour.  Afterward we walked around more to see some of the areas again such as the hall of Governors pictures. We parked in a pay lot nearby because we were also touring the Executive Mansion in the afternoon.  That was a great combo of tours!

data.title: must visit if in the capitol district
data.text: the New York State Capitol building is a tourist friendly and awesome sight to check out in the Capitol district. The history and architecture is stunning and the history is wonderful to behold. The guides were  well prepared and and quite nice.

data.title: Great place to visit!
data.text:
We took the tour of the state capital today. My 10 years old son loved it!
Great architecture, the guide was very good!

data.title: Dracula's Castle-on-the-Hudson
data.text: Stunning architecture. Absolutely beautiful craftsmanship - they really don't make them like this anymore. Don't miss the Million Dollar Staircase (I really did feel like I was in Dracula's Castle), the foyer outside the Senate public viewing gallery, and the library. Quirky and majestic building with guided tours offered.

data.title: Lovely building
data.text: Nice area of the city to explore, especially on a rainy day.  The family enjoyed the history and the museum right near by.

data.title: Must see in Albany
data.text: This was such a great tour, everyone should see this work of art. I wish I could remember our tour guides name, because he was great. It's a free tour, and there is parking behind it as well.

data.title: A very informative experience
data.text: The building is really worth the visit. I would advise you to take one of the tours to try to get your bearings and to learn some of the history of this lovely building. After this you can wander around the building to take a more detailed look at some of the artifacts that you feel the need to learn more about. This is a lovely building with an interesting history. You need to set aside two hours to do the building justice. Our guide was very well informed and. Outdoor answer all the questions asked of him, although retired  ow he had spent much of his working life in the building.
